title: Prospectus
text: This study aims to explore the intricate dynamics between cultural adaptation, localization strategies, and their broader impacts on the tourism sector’s resilience and sustainability against the backdrop of globalization. Drawing upon the psychological and operational adjustments of tourism personnel in the face of global crises highlighted by Simanjuntak and Fitriana (2020), this research will further examine the strategic incorporation of traditional cultural elements in enhancing tourism appeal, as evidenced by Simanjuntak and Fitriana (2020). Additionally, it will delve into the linguistic and cultural challenges and opportunities in the digital localization of tourism websites discussed by Cappelli et al. (2007), complemented by an investigation into the role of local tour guides in mediating global and local cultural exchanges, as analyzed by Salazar (2005). Lastly, the study will consider the digital localization practices of national tourism organizations and their impact on cultural tourism, following insights from Mele and Cantoni (2017). Collectively, these references will underpin a comprehensive model aimed at fostering sustainable tourism development that prioritizes cultural integrity, inclusiveness, and adaptability to changing global trends.

title: Prospectus
text:
Literature review
This section summarizes previous research related to the topic and identifies gaps that the current study aims to address. It is important to provide a comprehensive review of the literature to demonstrate the significance of the research question and the potential contributions of the study. The literature review should conclude with a clear statement of the research question or hypothesis that the study aims to address.

title: Prospectus
text:
Data preparation
This section describes the process of acquiring, organizing, and enriching the data that will be used to address the research question or hypothesis. It should include a detailed description of the data sources, the process of collecting and cleaning the data, and any additional data enrichment steps that will be taken to prepare the data for analysis.

title: Prospectus
text:
Data analysis
This section describes the feature selection and engineering, analysis techniques, and evaluation process that will be used to address the research question or hypothesis. It should include a detailed description of the features that will be used in the analysis, the specific analysis techniques that will be applied, and the process of evaluating the results.
